Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Bravehardon Hi Kerr, welcome reluctantly to this group. You will certainly find knowledgeable people here who will give you suggestions and spectacular support. It appears you are waiting on reports, my reco is not to worry about them until you see them. Keep positive and when you feel down..come here for some cheering up. B Thanks B, your right the hardest part is the waiting. My wife and I just want it cut out at this point (if it is C that is)
Posts.Title: High PSA reading

Posts.Content: Hi all, I just turned 70 and I went to my yearly checkup with and he did a DRE, in which he said it was abnormal. I had a DRE and a PSA test done about 2 years before and it was somewhat enlarged and my PSA was under 1. I went the next day for the PSA and the reading had jumped to 17.6. I was then sent to a urologist and he scheduled a biopsy for me about 2 weeks later. I am now waiting for the results of the biopsy and am very nervous. I have a Cystoscopy scheduled as well in a week. I am assuming it is PC and am now looking at the different options that are open for me. Any words of encouragement are appreciated.
Posts.Title: High PSA reading

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by lancepeace Hi. The DRE can raise PSA somewhat, better to draw blood before DRE. Many cases of prostate cancer are slow growing. We might be able to say more after you receive pathology report from biopsy. Hang in there. Thanks for the comment, I should say that the Urologist had me do another PSA test 2 weeks after he examined me and it was pretty much the same reading. As you say though I will wait until I get the report.
Posts.Title: High PSA reading

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Good luck with the biopsy results. Please give us the stats when you have them and we can comment further. Take care, Chuck thanks Chuck, will do.

Posts.Title: High PSA reading

Posts.Content: Well the results are in, I have a 9 on the G scale and they recommend radiation treatment instead of removing it. It seems when he did a DRE he could feel the cancer on the side of the prostate and he thinks they wouldn't be able to get it all. I now have to go for a bone scan and if that is OK i will start the radiation.
Posts.Title: High PSA reading

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Hi, Welcome to the forum with a reluctant acceptance to "the club." Another thing that elevates the PSA is an enlarged prostate. Although this probably would not explain all of your PSA reading, it does account for some of it. There could also be an infection that is contributing. The cystsoscopy is painless and just takes a moment or two. The doctor will just check the inside of your bladder and the urethra. The day before my surgery, my doctor also performed one on me to get a sneak preview of everything. As others have noted, many prostate cancers are slow growing. So, if you should be DX'd with it, chances are that it can be taken care of. Please let us know your test results as them come in and we'll be happy to offer our advice, experiences & knowledge. Take care, Chuck Thanks for the kind words Chuck, I am always expecting the worst but hoping for the best.
